rockthemes 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    rockthemes

    What?

    This is a collection of colour palettes based on classic rock album covers.

    Although ‘rock’ may be a stretch in some cases, the albums were chosen for their appealing covers

    Why?

    Because this repo of Metallica inspired palettes has been received quite well on various social media platforms

    Credit

    Thanks to Ryo for the tvthemes package which helped me get this off the ground quickly

    Installation

    This will probably not go to CRAN, so please install using the remotes package.

    #library(remotes)
#remotes::install_github("johnmackintosh/rockthemes")
library(rockthemes)
#> Warning: replacing previous import 'vctrs::data_frame' by 'tibble::data_frame'
#> when loading 'dplyr'
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
library(scales)
library(gapminder)

    Short Palettes

    Only 4 colours, but very nice

    rock_palette("californication")

    rock_palette("coltrane")

    rock_palette("electric")

    rock_palette("faithnomore")

    rock_palette("gogo")

    rock_palette("gunsnroses")

    rock_palette("harvey")

    rock_palette("heap")

    rock_palette("husker")

    rock_palette("janelle")

    rock_palette("maiden")

    rock_palette("metallica")

    rock_palette("miles")

    rock_palette("muse")

    rock_palette("nevermind")

    rock_palette("oasis")

    rock_palette("swift")

    rock_palette("tencc")

    10 colour palettes for ggplot2 use

    show_col(californication_pal()(10))

    show_col(coltrane_pal()(10))

    show_col(electric_pal()(10))

    show_col(gogo_pal()(10))

    show_col(gunsnroses_pal()(10))

    show_col(harvey_pal()(10))

    show_col(heap_pal()(10))

    show_col(husker_pal()(10))

    show_col(janelle_pal()(10))

    show_col(maiden_pal()(10))

    show_col(metallica_pal()(10))

    show_col(miles_pal()(10))

    show_col(muse_pal()(10))

    show_col(nevermind_pal()(10))

    show_col(oasis_pal()(10))

    show_col(real_thing_pal()(10))

    show_col(taylor_pal()(10))

    show_col(tencc_pal()(10))

    data <- gapminder::gapminder %>%
    filter(country %in% c("France", "Germany", "Ireland", "Italy", "Japan")) %>%
    mutate(year = as.Date(paste(year, "-01-01", sep = "", format = '%Y-%b-%d')))

ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_taylor()

    ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_tencc()

        ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_husker()

    
    ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_janelle()

    
    ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_californication()

        ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_miles()

    
    ggplot(data = data, aes(x = year, y = gdpPercap, fill = country)) +
    geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
    scale_x_date(breaks = data$year, date_labels = "%Y") +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), labels = scales::dollar) +
    scale_fill_muse()
